byline.original: By ANDREW POLLACK and MATTHEW GOLDSTEIN

abstract: Documents released by congressional investigators looking into increases in drug prices reveal Martin Shkreli of Turing Pharmaceuticals was focused solely on profit when company increased price of drug Daraprim by over fifty times; documents also show Valeant Pharmaceuticals International had carefully researched how much it could raise prices of heart drugs Isuprel and Nitropress before acquiring them and steeply increasing prices overnight.

headline.print_headline: Email Shows Profit Drove Drug Pricing
headline.main: Martin Shkreli All but Gloated Over Huge Drug Price Increases, Memos Show

snippet: Documents released by a congressional panel show that Valeant Pharmaceuticals and Turing Pharmaceuticals, Mr. Shkreli’s former company, sometimes raised prices as much as fiftyfold.
